intro: Salpixantha coccinea, commonly known as the red bellflower, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Bolivia and Peru. The plant is characterized by its striking red, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Salpixantha coccinea is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions.
